702279f-a.text:
3rd Avenue, north from 24th to 22nd Streets, showing the buildings on the west side of the avenue and the clearance on the east side, which was created by the tearing down of numerous frame dwellings. Third Avenue is being reconstructed into Brooklyn's northerly
extension of the Belt Parkway.
October 23, 1940
P. L. Sperr

View 2 shows to N.E. corner of Third Avenue and 24th Street, before demolition for the Parkway.
View 3 shows the east side of the avenue at 23rd Street, looking north.
July 22, 1940

view 2: neg. no. A-953
view 3: neg. no. A-954

702276f-a.text:
3rd Avenue, north from 22nd Street, showing demolition on both sides of the thoroughfare for the construction of the elevated Gowanus Parkway. Most of the demolition was on the east side of the avenue. view 3 shows the west side of the
avenue.
P. L. Sperr  April 21, 1941
Views 1,2,3

avenue.

Views 1,2,3
